title: The Great Wall of China
summary: The Great Wall winds like a dragon across mountains, showing how people worked together to protect their home.
imageAlt: Stylized illustration of the Great Wall winding over green hills.
author: Jacob Sutanto
body: The Great Wall of China stretches more than 13,000 miles. Long ago, rulers built it to guard their land from invaders.
Workers used stone, bricks, and packed earth to build the wall across steep mountains and deserts.
Watchtowers dotted the wall every few miles. Soldiers could spot danger and send smoke signals from tower to tower.
The wall also served as a road. Traders and messengers traveled along its top, carrying goods and news.
Today the Great Wall reminds us how teamwork and determination can create something mighty.

questions.prompt: Why did rulers decide to build the Great Wall of China?
options: To guard their land from invaders
To decorate the mountains with art
To grow gardens on the wall
questions.explanation: The wall was designed to protect the country from attacks.

questions.prompt: Which materials were used to build the wall?
questions.explanation: Workers used sturdy materials to cross mountains and deserts.

questions.prompt: Watchtowers let soldiers send ______ signals from one tower to another.
questions.explanation: Smoke signals traveled quickly between towers to warn of danger.

questions.prompt: Match each feature of the wall with its purpose.

answer.d: Keep the wall standing for centuries

questions.explanation: Each design choice helped the Great Wall protect and connect people.

questions.prompt: Place these wall facts in the order mentioned in the passage.
sequence: Rulers decided to guard their land
Soldiers used watchtowers to send signals
Traders and messengers traveled along the top
questions.explanation: The passage explains protection first, then building, signaling, and travel.

questions.prompt: The wall stretches more than ______ miles across China.
questions.explanation: The text says it stretches more than 13,000 miles.

questions.prompt: How did the wall help people besides soldiers?
options: It served as a road for traders and messengers.
It provided swimming pools for children.
questions.explanation: The top of the wall became a pathway for carrying goods and news.

questions.prompt: Give one example from the passage that shows teamwork built the wall.
acceptableAnswers: Workers used stone, bricks, and packed earth together to build across mountains.
Soldiers and workers cooperated to guard land and send signals.
questions.explanation: Many people shared skills to create and use the Great Wall.

questions.prompt: Why is the wall compared to a dragon in the summary?
options: It twists across mountains in a long, powerful shape.
It breathes fire on nearby villages.
It sleeps during the winter months.
questions.explanation: Like a dragon, the wall winds across the land in a long, strong line.

questions.prompt: What lesson does the passage say the Great Wall teaches us today?
options: Teamwork and determination can build mighty things.
Walls are the best place to plant gardens.
Traveling is more fun than working together.
questions.explanation: The wall reminds people that working together creates lasting strength.

prompts: Imagine sending a signal from one tower to another. What would you tell them?
What would you pack for a walk along the Great Wall?
